comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Wikipedia (using Political Graveyard as a source) indicates that he was married twice. His second wife, Anne (Weightman) Walker, whom he married in 1908, seems more likely for a photograph used in 1913. 6/20/1913 (date written on negative) is about the time her husband was nominated as ambassador to Austria-Hungary. This photo is probably from earlier, since she was approaching 60 in 1913. According to her obituary in the NYT select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20D17F6355B1373... [subscription required] her first husband was Robert J.C. Walker bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=W000066

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Yes, looks like the same woman, just maybe a little younger.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: As a reminder, I started a biography of her husband here in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederic_Courtland_Penfield [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3842837558/]

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started a biography of her here: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anne_Weightman

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton and pennylrichardsca: Thank you for your information. I agree that this is Mrs. Frederic Courtland Penfield (Anne Weightman Walker).  We will add this to the record when we update.
